notifications.body: Today, we launch the first iteration of Collaboration Engine : The world’s simplest solution for building powerful, real-time collaboration features into web applications.  Read on to learn more about the problems we set out to solve, how Collaboration Engine works, and how you can start using it.

notifications.body: Vaadin 14.4 is the latest long-term support (LTS) version of the Vaadin platform. This new version features faster startup in development mode, live reload for frontend changes, and an API to show helper text in form input components.
notifications.title: Faster dev-mode startup in Vaadin 14.4

notifications.body: Design systems are in vogue. Many well-known companies, from Shopify to Google, use them to ensure consistency in their products and efficiency in their product development. Done right, a design system can be a tremendous help to application developers and designers alike. Unfortunately, the concept is often presented in a highly abstract, poorly defined and ill-explained way. If this is what you think, this article is for you.  Read on to learn what design systems are, how they can help in the context of application development, and how developers can use Vaadin's new design system to maximize efficiency and productivity across web app development projects in the enterprise.
notifications.title: A better way to build UIs: An introduction to design systems

notifications.body: And it's free! At Vaadin Dev Day events, you get to see developers from the Vaadin team presenting technical topics on web development. Traditionally, this event is held in person in different cities throughout the year. At the beginning of 2020, this changed and the event was moved online and offered free to everyone.
notifications.title: Vaadin Dev Day online is here again

notifications.body: We introduced a new TypeScript-based API for building client-side views in Vaadin 15. In the subsequent Vaadin 16 and 17 releases, we added support for client-side forms and improved the development experience with live reload. In upcoming releases, we're working on helpers for offline views, support for reactive backends, and stateless authentication.
